00017 struct SDL_cond;
00018 struct SDL_Thread;
00019 class ThreadPool;
00020 typedef int (*ThreadFunc) (void*);
00021 struct CmdLineIntf;
00022 
00023 struct Action {
00024  virtual ~Action() {}
00025  virtual int handle() = 0;
00026 };
00027 
00028 struct ThreadPoolItem {
00029  ThreadPool* pool;
00030  SDL_Thread* thread;
00031  std::string name;
00032  bool working;
00033  bool finished;
00034  bool headless;
00035  SDL_cond* finishedSignal;
00036  SDL_cond* readyForNewWork;
00037  int ret;
00038 };
00039 
00040 class ThreadPool {
00041 private:
00042  SDL_mutex* mutex;
00043  SDL_cond* awakeThread;
00044  SDL_cond* threadStartedWork;
00045  SDL_cond* threadStatusChanged;
00046  Action* nextAction; bool nextIsHeadless; std::string nextName;
00047  ThreadPoolItem* nextData;
00048  bool quitting;
00049  std::set<ThreadPoolItem*> availableThreads;
00050  std::set<ThreadPoolItem*> usedThreads;
00051  void prepareNewThread();
00052  static int threadWrapper(void* param);
00053  SDL_mutex* startMutex;
00054 public:
00055  ThreadPool();
00056  ~ThreadPool();
00057  
00058  ThreadPoolItem* start(ThreadFunc fct, void* param = NULL, const std::string& name = "unknown worker");
00059  // WARNING: if you set headless, you cannot use wait() and you should not save the returned ThreadPoolItem*
00060  ThreadPoolItem* start(Action* act, const std::string& name = "unknown worker", bool headless = false); // ThreadPool will own and free the Action
00061  bool wait(ThreadPoolItem* thread, int* status = NULL);
00062  bool waitAll();
00063  void dumpState(CmdLineIntf& cli) const;
00064 };
00065 
00066 extern ThreadPool* threadPool;

00068 void InitThreadPool();
00069 void UnInitThreadPool();

00073 template<typename _T>
00074 struct _ThreadFuncWrapper {
00075  typedef int (_T::* FuncPointer)();
00076  template< FuncPointer _func >
00077  struct Wrapper {
00078   static int wrapper(void* obj) {
00079    return (((_T*)obj) ->* _func)();
00080   }
00081   
00082   static ThreadPoolItem* startThread(_T* const obj, const std::string& name) {
00083    return threadPool->start((ThreadFunc)&wrapper, (void*)obj, name);
00084   }
00085  };
00086 };
00087 
00088 #define StartMemberFuncInThread(T, memberfunc, name) \
00089 _ThreadFuncWrapper<T>::Wrapper<&memberfunc>::startThread(this, name)
00090 
00091 
00092 #endif
